result.execSummary:
All charges against Jamey L Podoll in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jamey L Podoll is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: State moves to dismiss matter due to matter being consolidated into Sauk County, Court dismisses
Scheduling Order
Jury trial on September 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jamey L Podoll in court, in custody by video from Sauk County Jail with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15 CF 428, waives reading of complaint, $1,000.00 sign bond, standard felony conditions, no contact w/G.S. and P.S., and their residences, Waiver of Right to Prelim filed, Court accepts Waiver, probable cause found, bound over, Information filed, waives reading, stands mute, not guilty pleas entered, matter to be set for jury trial Br. 1, 15 CM 100, defendant appearing on warrant, quashed, to track w/felony matter
from Atty Lawton requesting an initial appearance on 15 CF 428 via video from the Sauk County Jail, 15 CM 100 to track
For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by Atty Genda
and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by Atty Genda

for Atty Lawton
failed to appear on 9-29-15 for return date.
Defendant Jamey L Podoll not in Court.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. defendant not present, State withdraws offer, requesting warrant, Court authorizes warrant
Order Allowing Withdrawal of Defense Counsel signed by Court.

Defendant Jamey L Podoll in court with attorney Maura O'Connell Melka.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to withdrawl was filed by Atty Melka prior to todays hearing.  Court granted the Motion to withdraw.  Current address given on record.  Defendant will be seeking other counsel.  New return date set.  Return date scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

to Withdraw as Counsel w/proposed Order filed by Atty Melka - by fax
Per Judge Voigt - she stays on until we here from defendant in this case (man) 7-30-15
Return date at 08-19-2015 02:45 pm
Return date at 08-10-2015 02:45 pm
from Atty Melka requesting a reset for the 7/14/15 return date - by fax
Requesting a reset of return hearing on 7/14/15 - atty is unavailable.  Filed by Atty Melka

Attorney Maura O'Connell Melka appeared. Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Melka believes there will be a resolution.  Requesting a new return date.  State did not object.  Return date scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List with Petition for Leave to file Additional Motions filed by ADA Chris Genda
Discovery letter filed.
to Appear and Act filed by Atty Melka
Defendant's Motion for Discovery and Inspection, and Defendant's Motion for Leave for Additional Time to File Additional Motions filed by Atty Melka - by fax

Court called 3:02 pm. Defendant, Jamey L Podoll, appeared. Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Petition is reviewed. Court finds defendant conditionally indigent and appoints Atty. Maura Melka. Defendant to pay $75/mo starting April 15, 2015 and the 15th thereafter. Court adjourned 3:13pm.
Indigency hearing on March 10, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Filed by defendant.
